title: Trump pardons Nikola founder Trevor Milton in securities fraud case
summary: President Trump pardoned Nikola founder Trevor Milton, who was convicted of securities fraud in October 2022, after Milton donated $1.8M to Trump's 2024 re-election campaign. The pardon effectively eliminates $695.2 million in potential restitution to Nikola shareholders and prevents further legal consequences for Milton's fraudulent actions.
description: President Trump pardoned Trevor Milton, the founder of Nikola Corporation, who was convicted of securities fraud in October 2022. Milton had been sentenced to four years in prison for defrauding investors through misleading statements about the company's electric and hydrogen-powered truck capabilities. The pardon came after Milton donated $1.8M to Trump's 2024 re-election campaign, effectively eliminating $695.2 million in potential restitution to Nikola shareholders.
